subject: Web3
title: The Ethereum Crowdsale
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Ethereum Crowdsale.

hook.text: In 2014, Ethereum sold tokens to the public before the network even existed. It raised $18 million in 42 days.

buildup.text: Buyers sent Bitcoin and received Ether in return. It was one of the first 'initial coin offerings' ever.

discovery.text: Early buyers got Ether for about $0.31 each. Those tokens would later be worth thousands.

twist.text: Regulators later argued that many crowdsales were unregistered securities. Ethereum's sale remains controversial.

climax.text: The crowdsale model Ethereum pioneered was copied thousands of times in the 2017 ICO boom.

punchline.text: Ethereum funded itself by selling something that didn't exist yet.

quiz.question: How much did the Ethereum crowdsale raise?
